chat.msg: Welcome!
hello
Hello! I'm ready to start the game whenever you are. Let me know what you would like me to do.

from the bottom of the map icon, draw a line to one grid length away from the rock under the tiger. from there draw the line crossing the stick between the tiger and parot islands. next draw around the parrot's tree without intersecting the elephant. cross the rock bridge from there.
Got it. I have crossed the bridge made of rocks and now reached the island with a frog on it. Which direction should I go next?

chat.msg: Welcome!

from the tail of the dog in the top right corner draw a straight line 8 grid lengths to the left. from there loop the line 4 grid lengths down and than back  to the top of the log under the starting dog

I'm sorry, I'm not sure I understand your instructions. Can you please clarify which direction is left on the map? And could you also provide a starting point reference such as the white dog or the picnic carpet?
starting point is the tail of the dog in the top corner. that dog is in the top right hand corner.
Got it. So from the tail of the top right dog, I see that there is a wooden branch pointing south towards another white dog. How should I proceed from there to follow the correct path?

chat.msg: Welcome!
do you see the blue tent near the top
Yes, I see the tent. I am currently at the tent. What should be my next move?
from the bottom of the tent draw a line to the small cluster of rocks on the grass in front of the dog.
Roger that. I've walked south of the tent and I can see the rocks on the grass between me and the dog. What's next?
loop around the bush & dog upwards and than around the fire pit so you are on the other side
Okay, I've looped around the dog and bush and arrived at the other side of the fire pit. I can see a red mushroom to my right and a blue car to my left. What's the next step?
start going towards the blue car and when you are one grid away from it stop. turn around and follow the dirt path until you reach the top of the telescope
Great! I have walked towards the blue car and stopped when I was one grid away from it. Now I'm following the dirt path. I can see the blue telescope on top of the hill. What's next?
walk under the telescope until on the dirt path again, take the path to the rock edge and climb up and into the cabin. success

Got it. I have now walked under the telescope and found myself back on the dirt path. Following your instructions, I have reached the rocks' edge and climbed up into the cabin. Success! I have reached the final destination.

general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: That they are fluent in those languages. either its unintentional or it just flows better
